description: Sample nodes describe physical samples collected from subjects or environments. They are decorated with MIXS metadata.

body_site.description: Body site from which the sample was obtained.

fma_body_site.description: Typically a term from the FMA ontology.

location.description: Informal indicator of where sample was taken, ie clinic code, home, etc.

name.description: Sample name. It can have any format, but we suggest that you make it concise, unique and consistent within your lab, and as informative as possible. Every sample Name from a single Submitter must be unique.

organism.description: The most descriptive organism name for this sample (to the species, if relevant), eg microbiome.

sample_weight.description: Amount or size of sample (weight) that was collected.

sample_type.description: Type of sample, field intended for studies (VCU) that have their own controlled vocabulary of sample types, eg BC1D, BCKD, etc.

sample_type_desc.description: Optional description of sample types (indicates sample source/omic type), field intended for studies (VCU) that have their own controlled vocabulary of sample type descriptions.

supersite.description: Body supersite from which the sample was obtained.

tags.description: An array of descriptive strings to make the node 'taggable'.
